results.title: The McGillivray Family
results.creator_credit: Jonathon Hutchinson, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: The story of the McGillivrays takes place in Gunbower on Saturday morning at the Gunbower Football Complex. This is a portrait of a family that has always worked the land, either as farmers or sheep shearers. They share their love of sports and concerns about the effects of the drought on small regional towns. All with a sense of humour and a never give up attitude that families need to survive in the current climate.

results.title: Thanks for the Memories
results.creator_credit: Richard Greenhalgh, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: The people of Nanneella understand the value of bringing the community together as a way of raising morale and showing support in times of hardship. The town organised a community event in honour of the ACMI in the Regions visit to film in the area. The theme was water and the event was called ‘Thanks for the Memories’. Over 100 people attended the event which featured; music, poetry, raffles, mystery objects, food and lots of laughter.

results.title: Nanneella Primary School
results.creator_credit: Jason White, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: This small rural Primary School of 26 students is at the heart of Nanneella and its residents. With a motto of ‘A School and Community Together’ the Primary School is an integral part of all town events and social gatherings. The students are engaging and fun young individuals with clear ideas and hopes for the future. This film also features a performance from ‘Power Wars’, a musical piece that incorporates science and drama and won Nanneella Primary School the 2009 Archimedes Award.

results.title: The Reserve
results.creator_credit: Jonathon Hutchinson, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: This film shows what a group of passionate individuals can achieve to create a place for the whole town to enjoy. Volunteers and paid workers dedicated their time and energy to cleaning up Crown land in the middle of Nanneella. With assistance from the whole town and surrounding area the Nanneella Bushland Reserve is now used by the community for bonfires, social gatherings or just to sit and enjoy a picnic.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Campaspe
results.creator_credit: Richard Greenhalgh, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Nine stories about residents from around the Campaspe region in northern Victoria. Covering the towns of Nanneella, Gunbower and Colbinabbin, locals tell stories about their lives and their connection to the land and the community.

results.title: The Milky way = Dairy farming in Maffra
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: This film showcases farming in the Maffra region and features six farmers who are leading the way in innovation and new farming technologies. Alan Clyne and his son Allister together with Robert White and John White are involved in the Herd Improvement initiative. Graeme Anderson and his son Ross are making the most of new irrigation techniques. Max Warren introduces his Robotic Dairy, the first ever to be used in Australia.
results.title_for_label: The Milky way = Dairy farming in Maffra

results.title: Young voices of Maffra = Future leaders : Young voices of Maffra
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description:
This film focuses on the young people of Maffra. Eight students from Maffra Secondary College were interviewed, representing all the year levels, and asked to talk about life in a regional town, their hopes for the future and issues that affect them and their world.
The end result is a portrait of young rural Victorians who are thoughtful and engaging, with concerns about the environment, world politics and the survival of small towns.

results.title: Welcome to Maffra
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: This film starts with Darren McCubbin, the Mayor of the Wellington Shire, welcoming the audience to Maffra. Darren explains that we are about to visit some of the places and meet some of the people that make Maffra a unique place to live. The film features the Geoff Webster Centre, the Gippsland Vehicle Collection, the Maffra Gymnastics Club, the George Gray Centre, Wallaby Rise Restaurant, Cambrai Backpacker Hostel and Jenny McDavitt an Alpaca farmer and Ferial Zikerman who is now internationally known for her Maffra Cheese.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Maffra
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Kim Montgomery, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vox pops with the locals of Maffra. The township of Maffra in the Wellington Shire, southeast of Victoria, is home to approximately 4000 people and was chosen to host the third annual Small Towns Summit from 26 to 27 August 2009. The summit is an initiative of the Small Towns Victoria Program funded by Regional Development Victoria, organised by the Municipal Association of Victoria. The program aims to broadly address the issues facing small rural towns in Victoria.

results.title: Screen worlds : Interview with Ab Rogers
results.creator_credit: Dean Lawry, Csilla Csongvay and Kim Montgomery
results.brief_description: British designer Ab Rogers is founder and head of a multi-disciplinary studio in London ARD (Ab Rogers Desgin). Ab visited ACMI in December 2008 and the Content Development crew interviewed him in relation to his design and intent behind the Screen Worlds exhibition. He spoke about the tendering process, the challenges of designing for the Federation Square space, his overall approach to design and a brief introduction to the three sections, Emergence, Voices and Sensation.
